{{for|other uses|Class}} {{spoiler}} [[File:XC3 Same Class appearance 01.jpg|thumb|180px|Noah and Mio as Swordfighters]] '''Classes''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|クラス}}, ''Kurasu'') are a battle mechanic in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}.[https://topics.nintendo.co.jp/article/a4c0a78d-e993-4fae-8c8e-62c5927040fa Xenoblade Notebook vol. 4: A thorough explanation of the Arts in ''Xenoblade 3''].[https://topics.nintendo.co.jp/article/f86dd1d6-9eff-45ca-b244-fdb1174b4c84 Xenoblade Notebook vol. 5: Introducing the help for adventures in ''Xenoblade 3'' (Heroes).] == Overview == Each class is specific to a [[role]], [[Attacker]], [[Defender (XC3)|Defender]] or [[Healer]]. Depending on the Class, the available [[Battle Arts (XC3)|arts]] will vary. As arts of various Classes are obtained, it will become possible to use arts of several Classes at the same time. To change Classes, the relationships between team members must deepen. The appearance of the characters will change depending on the Class chosen. For example, if [[Noah]] becomes a [[Tactician]], he will wear an outfit inspired by Taion's. It's possible to change the [[Clothing]] a character wears regardless of class. Increasing the [[Class Rank (XC3)|rank]] of a class unlocks a class' Master Arts and Master Skills.https://www.nintendo.com/store/products/xenoblade-chronicles-3-switch/ Master Skills can be added to any other class to gain some of the passive abilities of their corresponding class. Master Arts can only be used on a class whose nation is the opposite of their original class (e.g. the Swordfighter is associated with Keves, so its arts would be compatible with the Zephyr class but not the Medic Gunner class). However, they can be used as part of Fusion Arts to combine and enhance the effects of both Arts and increase the [[Interlink]] level. [[File:Classes – Xenoblade Chronicles 3|thumb|240px|center|Classes]] == Class Change == [[File:XC3 Class Change.jpg|thumb|180px|left|Swordfighter to Zephyr Class Change for Noah and Mio]] Each Class has its own characteristics, but the six main characters can change Class (Japanese: {{lang|ja|クラスチェンジ}}, ''Kurasu chenji'') to any of the other five Classes. For example, by changing from [[Swordfighter]] to [[Zephyr]], the Role also changes from Attacker to Defender. While [[Hero]]es cannot be controlled by the player, the six playable characters can also be reclassed into the classes of Heroes; one party member will immediately gain the class of a newly acquired Hero, while the other party members must fight alongside that hero or a party member with their class active to unlock it. Each party member requires a different amount of '''Class Points''' (abbreviated '''CP''') to unlock and increase their class ranks; their compatibility with each different class is given a grade ranging from S to D, with S being the most compatible and D being the least. This grade multiplies the CP that the character earns from combat, as follows: {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:100%; valign:center;" !Aptitude |[[File:XC3 Aptitude D Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude C Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude B Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude A Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude S Icon.png|35px]] |- !CP Multiplier |50%||65%||75%||85%||100% |} Characters with a greater compatibility for a class will also require less effort to unlock the class. In particular, the character with an S-rank aptitude for a Hero class will be its inheritor, meaning that they will automatically have the class unlocked when it is acquired. {{clr}} == List of Classes == === {{XC3|-}} === {| class="xc1 centered sortable" ! {{for|the mechanic in {{XCX}}|Class Rank (XCX)}} {{spoiler}} The '''Class Rank''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|クラスランク}}, ''kurasu ranku'') is an important mechanic in {{XC3}}.
== Overview == It displays the rank of the [[Class (XC3)|Class]] assigned to a character. Class ranks are raised by gaining '''Class Points''', or '''CP''', in battle by defeating [[Enemy (XC3)|enemies]]. Each class starts out with one mastered [[Battle Arts (XC3)|Art]]. Ranking up a class earns new [[Battle Arts (XC3)|Arts]] or [[Skill (XC3)|Skills]]. Classes can also be ranked up by using [[Nopon Coin (Silver)|Silver Nopon Coins]].
== Class Rank effects == Increasing the class rank has the following effects:
* Each rank increases a character's stats, while the class is equipped. * Ranks 1 and 10 unlock one of the class's Arts as a Master Art. (Except for [[Soulhacker]]) * Rank 20 unlocks the class's Talent Art to be used by the character with any class. * Ranks 5 and 15 unlock one of the class's Skills as a Master Skill. (Except for Soulhacker which unlocks it at rank 10) * Ranks 5, 10, 15 and 20 upgrade all the class's Arts and Skills. (Except for Soulhacker) * Rank 10 unlocks the class's outfit as a [[Clothing]] option.
== Class Rank limit == The initial limit is rank 10 and when reached on any party member an [[Hero Quest|Ascension Quest]] is unlocked for that corresponding [[Hero]], with the exception of the starting six Classes - these are tied to Side Story quests which require a certain amount of progress in the main story to activate, with the ones for Noah and Mio being mandatory for plot advancement. To activate the quest, the Hero must be accompanying the party while heading to the specified location marked with a '?' on the map. After completing the quest, the rank limit reaches 20 for the party members and the Hero automatically increases their rank from 10 to 20. {{clr}}
